meanings.definition: A person or thing acting or serving in place of another.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the coach put in a substitute to replace the injured player.
meanings.sent2: The substitute teacher filled in for Mrs. Smith while she was on vacation.
meanings.sent3: The substitute bus driver accidentally took the wrong route and ended up at the zoo!
meanings.sent4: Her new puppy quickly became a substitute for the friend she missed from her old neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The emergency flashlight was a reliable substitute for the broken lamp.

meanings.definition: To use or add in place of another.
meanings.sent1: I had to substitute almond milk for regular milk in the recipe.
meanings.sent2: When the store ran out of apples, I had to substitute pears instead.
meanings.sent3: She decided to substitute her usual morning jog with a yoga session.
meanings.sent4: His absence was substituted by a recorded video message played at the event.
meanings.sent5: To save time, she chose to substitute a quick phone call for a long email.

meanings.definition: To replace or fill in for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The assistant manager will substitute for the manager during her maternity leave.
meanings.sent2: Can you substitute the blue paint with green in the art project?
meanings.sent3: He tried to substitute his missing phone with a tablet for the day.
meanings.sent4: The actor had to substitute his usual costume with a last-minute makeshift outfit.
meanings.sent5: She had to substitute her regular coffee with tea due to a caffeine sensitivity.
